title: Are you guys ever gonna balance Lee Sin?
body: I know he's one of Riots favorite junglers and all, but hasn't he been insanely overpowered for long enough to make plenty of cool videos?  Even better, how bout you nerf him till he actually sucks for a change so we can see some variety?

replies.body: Remove ward hops. Lee balanced, strong but balanced

I think so. Since a Lee that plays smart will always have a ward up with green trinket, he always has an escape, whereas without ward hops, he has to position far more intelligently to avoid getting caught. Personally I find his mobility far more annoying than his damage, but Bronze seems to be (blessedly?) devoid of Lee Sin players, so I don't have too much experience with him.
Let him keep his mobility they need to nerf his dmg a champ with as much mobility as him shouldnt have that much insane dmg

Reds actually commented on this a week or two ago; basically Lee is a problem but he isn't the most pressing problem atm (cue the downvote rage). They'll probably look into reworking his and a lot of other jack-of-all-trades bruisers (ie. Irelia) at some point, possibly a year or two from now, I don't know, I think ChampUp is mostly focused of getting Poppy and Tristana updates out right now, after that there are champs that have been long waiting for some love (Yorick Urgot WW Taric etc.) and are honestly further out of whack than Lee Sin is.

Lower the range of his Q (The first cast, not the second)
Make his first Q cost the full energy cost of both, refunding 20 energy for dealing damage with the recast Q.

My only real problem with lee is that he gets to throw his Q out at a very long range for a gap closer(skill shot or not) and is not punished for misusing it. 

This would make him have to be closer to gank a lane. And poking with his Q and nothing else will drain his energy.
Wow we all got downvoted by angry Lee players.  Yay for board logic!

I actually began using Lee Sin and found him a lot harder to use then I thought. I am usually a Rengar or Khazix main, and personally feel both of these champs are a ton better than him. I realized anyone that does really good with Lee Sin has my respect.
Didn't they already try to rework him but didn't go through with it? I doubt Riot is gonna revisit him anytime soon.
